resources.string: Take a look at \"Show WiFi Password\"
If you think this app is useful, would you mind taking a moment to rate it? It won\'t take more than a minute. Thanks for your support!

If the Root permissions denied, Please revoke as this app needs Root Permissions to read your WiFi Password If your device is not Rooted and you wish to Root Try searching google for How to Root <Your Phone Model>
Trying to Root without proper Knowledge has a possibility of finish up with bricking your device. So make sure you know what you are doing before trying to Root your device

Even though we can not view saved WiFi passwords without Root permission we can still try to retrieve them from Routers home page. So we are going to find out the Routers home page address and load it for you, Then you have to enter the Username and Password of the router

If you can reach to the Router Username and Password for Router Homepage are printed on it. Do not worry if you can,t reach the Router 60% of Routers uses admin as the Username and Password below is a list of most used Router gateway Username and Passwords

Why Root Permissions

In order to retrieve WiFi passwords we need Root access. The android system does not allow to read Password details unless you have Root access


Then What is No Root Mode

Even-though we can not access passwords stored in your device with out Root access, We can still try to find out the WiFi passwords from your Routers home page

In Case you forgot the Username and Password try the mostly used Username and Password pairs provided

WiFi Passwords are Invalid

Shows a long sequence of random numbers and letters (Hash code) instead of real password.This situation mostly occur on some Samsung devices, As they encrypt WiFi password before saving them and it is almost impossible to decrypt and read

To solve this error, Follow the These steps
Get a root file Explorer from Play Store such as ES-file-explorer
And go to /system directory
And open the file build.prop for editing
And find out the line ro.securestorage.support=true
Finally change it ro.securestorage.support=false

Do not edit anything else on the file, It could brick your device. And editing this line also has a risk of losing your saved WiFi networks data for the first Time.

Contact Developer

Use the email address appeditmobile@gmail.com, to contact us if you need extra support
